abstract: Euro-zone inflation accelerated to 3.5 percent in March, the fastest pace since 1992 and a level that may heighten inflationary concerns at the European Central Bank.
snippet: Euro-zone inflation accelerated to 3.5 percent in March, the fastest pace since 1992 and a level that may heighten inflationary concerns at the European Central Bank.
lead_paragraph: Euro-zone inflation accelerated in March to the fastest pace since 1992, official data showed Monday, giving the European Central Bank more reason to look with concern on the announcement of a big wage agreement in Germany.

headline.main: Inflation Accelerates in Nations Using Euro
headline.print_headline: Inflation Accelerates In Nations Using Euro
